Piper Frost opened the car door, and stepped out onto the lush green fields that welcomed her to Macro University; Her new home.

Piper was a beautiful young woman at 19 years old. Her hair was a rare white color, which flowed down the back of her head at a cute medium length. Piper also had bright-blue eyes that shined in the afternoon sunlight. She was wearing a *light-blue T-Shirt, which contrasted cutely with her *dark-blue skirt. The young lady turned around to wave goodbye to the high school friend who gave her a ride, before walking forwards towards the Ceremony Hall in front of her.

As she walked, Piper breathed in the fall air, smiling; The breeze had the pleasant scent of *nature to it, with a hint of apples coming from a nearby orchard. The young lady looked around her; The campus grounds were picture perfect, with modern buildings, soft-rolling hills, and lots of apple trees. A number of well-kept stone walkways circled the grounds, and led to a wide variety of newly-built buildings, which had modern architecture and huge glass windows. Piper felt that instead of being at a college, she was at a space center... or Google headquarters. A person could easily be lost in the beauty of the place... Which could put them in grave danger.

Piper saw a group of five or so girls walking into the Ceremony Hall ahead of her. She quickly ran to catch up to them. As she entered the carpeted lobby inside, she saw around 200 girls hanging around, chatting about their summers or homes. Piper thought she saw an old friend of hers in the nearby corner, and was about to walk over to chat them up. However, she suddenly heard the booming voice of the school's headmistress. "Hello, hello! Yes, greetings everyone! Please make your way into the auditorium!"

Piper quickly got swept along with the crowd. As she passed the grand staircase, she briefly saw a black-haired girl run down to rejoin the group, grinning. Piper thought she saw a small gray device in the girl's hand... something that looked similar to a ray gun. Given the theme of the school, Piper had a pretty good idea what it was... but before she could do anything, she found herself pushed along with the crowd of girls, soon sitting in a plush seat in the Auditorium.

Piper eagerly ran over to the board, and quickly scanned for her own name. "Frost, Frost, Frost..." she said, as her eyes raced up and down. "Oof!" she said, as she was accidentally elbowed by some of the other girls who were also eagerly surrounding the board. "Sorry..." someone said. However, when Piper turned to look at the girl who bumped her, the girl disappeared before her very eyes! Piper blinked, in shock of course. Suddenly, out of the corner of her eye, she saw the black-haired girl from earlier dashing away, holding something... or rather, someone. Piper made a note to be careful, and to watch her back.

The white-haired protagonist of this story looked back at the board, and re-found her name. She was assigned room 211, with another name written next to hers: "Gwen". Piper hoped that this Gwen was safe to be around at least. She recalled back to the speech in the auditorium a few moments before; Headmistress Megan Macro had said that roommates were carefully chosen by the faculty, so that things were "As safe as possible". Piper hoped she was right.

Piper walked with the massive crowd of students to the dormitories complex on the East side of campus. She made sure to stay close to the crowd, in case that black-haired girl or an upperclassman was waiting by the sides to 'ambush' weaker members of the pack. As the group moved across campus, Piper felt her own stomach growl; She suddenly remembered the shrunken girl that had disappeared earlier. Without thinking, Piper licked her lips, and salivated a little, before shaking her head and snapping out of it. She still hadn't made up her mind of whether she wanted to make friends at this school... or make meals.

. . .

A few minutes later, Piper was walking down the 2nd floor hallway as she scanned the room numbers. "208, 209, 210... Aha, 211!" Piper exclaimed, as she arrived at an open door. Inside, was a cute blond girl; She had pink highlights on her medium-short hair, and she was lying down on her belly reading a comic book. "Oh, hey! You must be Piper!!" the blond girl eagerly exclaimed, jumping up and running over to shake Piper's hand. "I'm Gwen- Gwen Poole!" the blond girl said. Her handshake was warm, and had an excited energy to it- Gwen had a sincere and friendly smile on her face. <"Maybe this will work out after all...!"> Piper thought to herself, as she greeted Gwen back. Piper saw that Gwen had already decorated her side of the room with a few superhero posters- There was one of Miles Morales Spider-Man, and one of the Avengers.

"Oh my gosh, we are going to LOVE it here! I stopped by the dining hall earlier, and they have... like, everything! And the Library has tons of comics too... I-I mean, my collection's better of course, but still! OH! And our class schedule is super light, we have "Intro to Shrinking" at 10:00 AM tomorrow together! Did I mention that the lake on the west side is beautiful? And that research complex in the northwest is totally spooky, I bet they perform all sorts of crazy and mind-bending experiments there... Hey, do you think they have any radioactive spiders there? Can I get Spider-Man powers?!? CAN I GET SPIDER MAN POWERS?!?" Gwen gushed, getting really excited.

Piper couldn't help but giggle from Gwen's cuteness. She was glad to have a roommate who she felt totally safe around... Maybe she really could survive this year without being... eaten. That reminded her.

Piper explained to Gwen about the black-haired girl she saw earlier, warning Gwen to watch out for her. Gwen nodded, and listened intently. "Huh... So she stole one of those shrinking guns early, huh? I heard there's quite a few versions of those guns, which have different shrink-features..." Gwen mused. "I bet that girl is totally, like, the supervillain of this story, and is plotting some massive plan to overthrow all we hold dear, and subjugate the world to her ideals... Neat. : 3 " Gwen said causally. Piper was amazed; Her roommate had somehow taken her advice very seriously and very carelessly at the same time. Piper began to like her a lot.

Gwen leapt back onto her own bed. "We better get some rest!! I heard tons of upperclassmen prey on newbies like us, so we need our ENERGY if we want to survive the first day!" she said, before promptly turning over and falling into a deep sleep, snoring loudly. Piper grinned, and made up her own bed. Maybe Gwen had the right idea... In reality, this university was incredibly dangerous, with dozens of hungry girls waiting around every corner. Maybe taking things lightly like Gwen did really was for the best...! Piper brushed her teeth, and got into her own bed.

. . .

Piper woke up the next morning at 8:00 AM, rubbing her eyes sleepily. She saw Gwen by their sink brushing her teeth. Piper took a moment to think... They should probably grab some breakfast, so they should head over to the dining hall. Though... it would probably be quicker to steal a shrink ray and grab a meal "On-The-Go". Piper blinked- What was she thinking?! She couldn't just eat someone... All these girls are still real people, with their own lives! Still, she was very hungry, as she rubbed her growling tummy...

It seemed it was time. Time for Piper to decide who she wanted to be at Macro University. Would she make friends? ...Or make meals?

"I take it that you're after something particular that's at this school?"

Mary looked at Piper smugly. "So you're an intelligent one, huh? Most of these girls here just join without a second thought, they're just in it for the tinies." Mary chuckled. "Fair enough."

Mary continued. "I can't divulge everything to a newbie like you, of course. But I can tell you enough. This school... is more than it seems. The rayguns, the research department, Megan Macro... This place isn't a school, it's a Fish Tank."

Piper blinked. "A... fish tank?". She repeated. Piper still had her Tier-1 Raygun behind her back, and had her finger on the trigger. Not like it did much good... The 6 other girls probably had fully-charged forcefields, and Piper could probably only get in one good shot if she tried anything... Piper racked her brain, trying to think of something to get her and Gwen out of this mess. "The 'heck are you talking about?" Gwen asked. Mary put her index finger up at Gwen, like someone would do to a child. "Quiet, Pinky. The adults are having a conversation here."

Mary went on. "Yes, a Fish Tank. One giant Fish Tank for Megan Macro to test her grand Experiment inside. The core of this school is the research department; They've been developing their Rayguns and the technology present here for a long time, much longer than this school has been around. As you probably know, our class is the 4th class to ever attend this university; It's pretty new." Mary said, putting her hands on her hips. "That's because they recently started needing subjects to test their new toys out on. This entire University, and all its students, are nothing more than one big test simulation for their Raygun tech."

Both Gwen and Piper were very surprised. "Y-You mean..." Gwen said, "...that we're being experimented on? We're like mice inside of a giant maze?" Gwen asked.

Mary scoffed at her. "Please, you didn't think anything was odd about this whole situation?" she laughed. "Of course you didn't, 'Pinky... You just got your acceptance letter with it's full tuition scholarship, and accepted without thinking twice.". Gwen blinked. "W-What do you mean? I won that scholarship, I ap..."

Mary chuckled. "Shut up, Pinkie. Every student here 'won' that scholarship one way or another. The acceptance letter told it was because of your 'exceptional talents'... Ha! The truth was, they were happy just to get more fodder for their little game they're playing here."

Piper pressed forward with her questions. "So... what's the point of it all then? What is the school trying to test?". Mary turned back to her. "For now, just their lower-tier Rayguns. They want to see how a population of vore girls reacts and behaves with their tech. The school is taking things at a boringly slow rate, if you ask me..." Mary said. "Eventually, they will probably want to start distributing their technology outside of the school, to increase their influence and resources. Megan Macro's basically obsessed with creating a vore-filled utopia, and wants to use her tech to paint the world in the way she wants to see it"

Piper's mind raced. Everything Mary was saying sounded really crazy, though given what this school was like, she couldn't help but feel that what Mary was saying was true. At the same time, Piper knew she couldn't keep Mary talking forever; She needed to find a way to get out of there, ASAP. She ran her finger over the sides of her gun... Earlier, Garnet had told Piper to keep her special Tier 1, but she still couldn't figure out what was unique about it. Piper kept trying to find a hidden switch, a tiny button, or... something that could help her out. Her finger slid over the trigger again, which was when she realized something; It had two notch settings, not just one. If she pulled it down all the way... She could potentially access a hidden feature of the raygun. "So what then?" Piper asked Mary. "Megan Macro's trying to take over the world?"

Mary laughed. "She doesn't want to rule the world, she cares more about her research. All she wants is to alter society to match her ideals and fantasies." Mary said, inching closer to Piper. "That's where she and I are different. You see, I don't think we should just change the world... I think we should own it. Girls like us are here because we're the rarest of rare in society; We're vore girls, and we're designed to be natural born predators, consuming the worthless masses of this planet." she grinned. "The girls of 'Mary's Order' think it's time we take our place atop society, and use this school's technology to put us there."

Gwen starred in disbelief. "Right... You're actually batsh*t crazy then."

Piper pressed her luck, and tried to ask one final question. "But the teachers and faculty have superior weapons to your own... And the entire research complex is heavily fortified. How do you expect to take over the school?". Mary chuckled at Piper's question, as if it was a trivial matter. Piper's eyes narrowed. "You're after something, aren't you? Some sort of... weapon. Is it some kind of Raygun?"

Mary laughed. "This school has darker secrets that just Rayguns."

Mary starred Piper down, hard. She looked a little irritated that she accidentally went on for so long. "Okay, enough questions. Spill it- Are you with us or not?"

Piper sighed deeply, and pulled the trigger on her special Tier-1 Raygun, hard.

Piper shook her head. "I don't know... Mary sounded like she's after something in particular. Something in the research department... like a weapon." Piper said. She turned to Gwen, and looked her in the eye. "We... We can't let Mary succeed, I have a really bad feeling about whatever she's looking for.
